title: Welcome to Samarkand
desc_registan: Built between the 15th and 17th centuries, Registan was the heart of ancient Samarkand. It served as a public square and educational center with three stunning madrasahs. It's one of the world’s most famous Islamic architectural ensembles.
desc_shahizinda: This necropolis was built from the 11th to 15th centuries and is famous for its colorful tiles and sacred tombs. It’s said to include the grave of Qusam ibn Abbas, cousin of Prophet Muhammad, making it an important pilgrimage site.
desc_bibi: Commissioned by Tamerlane in the 14th century after his India campaign, it was one of the largest mosques in the Islamic world. It symbolized his power and remains a masterpiece of Timurid architecture.
desc_observatory: Built in the 1420s by astronomer-ruler Ulugh Beg, this observatory was one of the most advanced of its time. He used it to calculate star positions with amazing accuracy, centuries ahead of Europe.
